title: Telangana factory tragedy: Toll rises to 35; many workers still missing
content: A massive explosion at a Sigachi Industries chemical plant in Telangana's Medak district has claimed 35 lives, with fears the toll may rise. A dryer malfunction is suspected to have triggered the blast, which reduced the facility to rubble. Rescue operations are ongoing, complicated by a lack of information on the number of workers present.

title: Kicked, dragged in front of staff: Odisha bureaucrat assaulted over call with BJP leader
content: In Bhubaneswar, a shocking incident occurred where six individuals assaulted BMC Additional Commissioner Ratnakar Sahu in his office, allegedly over a phone conversation. The attack, which involved dragging and beating Sahu, prompted condemnation from political figures like Aparajita Sarangi and Naveen Patnaik. Police have arrested three individuals, including a BJP corporator, and are investigating further.

title: HP cloudburst: Flash flood ravages Mandi; houses, vehicles, bridges washed away
content: Cloudbursts in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi district triggered devastating flash floods, leaving over a dozen missing and at least one dead. Houses, vehicles, and bridges were washed away, forcing evacuations, including the Pandoh bazaar. Landslides and road blockages were reported across the district, prompting the closure of educational institutions in Mandi and Kangra.

title: Jaishankar says India won't be deterred by nuclear blackmail; rebuts Trump
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar affirmed India's firm stance against nuclear coercion. He highlighted that terrorists and their state sponsors will face consequences. Jaishankar cited the Pahalgam attack as economic warfare. He mentioned India's retaliatory actions, including Operation Sindoor. He also clarified that trade talks with the US remain unaffected by past India-Pakistan tensions. India maintains a bilateral approach with Pakistan.

title: No fuel for 62L vehicles in Delhi from today: Old CNG vehicles exempted
content: Delhi is set to implement strict rules for end-of-life vehicles. Starting Tuesday, ELVs will not get fuel at city stations. Authorities will impound vehicles older than 15 years (petrol) or 10 years (diesel). ANPR cameras are installed at fuel pumps to identify these vehicles. This action follows NGT and Supreme Court directives.

title: OpenAI is shutting down for the next week; CRO Mark Chen warns employees
content: OpenAI is temporarily closing down operations next week. This is to allow employees to rest after long work hours. Meta is trying to recruit OpenAI staff with high salary offers. Mark Chen warned OpenAI staff about Meta's tactics. Meta recently hired some OpenAI researchers. OpenAI is planning to change its compensation strategy.

title: Chess | 'Bad blood' - Anish Giri takes fresh jibe at Nakamura and Nepo
content: Anish Giri criticized Ian Nepomniachtchi and Hikaru Nakamura over their protest at the FIDE World Rapid and Blitz Teams event, questioning their sense of entitlement after arriving late and replaying games. Nepo and Nakamura fired back with sarcastic remarks, while Giri insisted he only reacts strongly to perceived injustice.

title: US moves faster to revoke citizenship: Immigrants at risk
content: The Donald Trump administration intensified its focus on revoking US citizenship for naturalized individuals. A Justice Department memo directs attorneys to prioritize civil proceedings against those who obtained citizenship illegally or pose a threat. This impacts roughly 25 million naturalized citizens. The directive targets individuals involved in war crimes, human rights abuses, or criminal activities.

title: 'Not favourable': VP Dhankhar criticises India's political atmosphere
content: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar voiced his apprehension regarding the current political climate in India, deeming it unfavorable for democracy. He emphasized that political rivals should not be treated as enemies and urged for improved decorum among lawmakers.

title: Amazon founder’s last minute text sends plane full of tequila to Venice
content: Venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya gifted Jeff Bezos a case of his ultra-premium tequila for his Venice wedding to Lauren Sánchez. Palihapitiya mentioned Bezos's last-minute request on X. The wedding, a lavish three-day affair reportedly costing $50 million, saw celebrity guests like Bill Gates and Kim Kardashian.

title: Gold price prediction today and in the near-term
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are anticipated to exhibit a slightly bearish trend due to easing geopolitical tensions and positive trade deal discussions ahead of the US tariff deadline. Despite support from ETF inflows and a weaker dollar, focus shifts to trade negotiations and corporate earnings.

title: IAF strip, used in 3 wars, secretly ‘sold off’ using fake papers
content: In a brazen act of deceit, a mother-son duo in Ferozepur, Punjab, allegedly sold off a World War II-era airstrip in 1997, colluding with revenue officials. The Punjab and Haryana High Court intervened, leading to an FIR against Usha Ansal and Naveen Chand after a Vigilance Bureau probe confirmed the land belonged to the Indian Air Force.

title: 38 hrs after AI 171 crash: AI Boeing 777 got stall, GPWS alerts on Delhi take-off
content: Shortly after takeoff from Delhi on June 14, an Air India Boeing 777 bound for Vienna experienced a stall warning and ground proximity warning, leading to a significant altitude loss. Pilots successfully recovered the aircraft, and the flight continued safely to its destination.

title: Trusting ChatGPT too much? OpenAI CEO to users; ‘It should be used like a… ’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: 'Ugly humour': Turkish cartoonist detained for satire on Prophet Muhammad
content: A Turkish cartoonist was arrested and his magazine targeted after publishing a controversial cartoon depicting the Prophet Muhammad, sparking outrage and reigniting debates over free speech versus religious sensitivity. The cartoon, showing the Prophet Muhammad and Prophet Moses amid missiles, led to an attack on the magazine's headquarters and an investigation for allegedly insulting religious values.

title: Wimbledon Day 1: On sweltering day, Alcaraz stretched to five sets; multiple records set
content: Wimbledon witnessed scorching temperatures and thrilling upsets as defending champion Carlos Alcaraz battled to a five-set victory. Numerous seeds fell, including Daniil Medvedev, while British players achieved a historic presence in the tournament. Taylor Fritz's match was controversially halted due to the 11 pm curfew, leaving him frustrated after a remarkable comeback.

title: 'The America Party': Musk says alternative needed if 'insane spending bill' passes
content: Elon Musk is threatening to form a new "America Party" if Republicans pass Donald Trump's spending bill. He pledged support for primary opponents against GOP members, specifically targeting fiscal conservatives.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex above 83,600
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday. While Nifty50 was above 25,500, BSE Sensex was marginally up.

title: ‘RIP OG’: NFL mourns death of former Steelers, Bengals DT Oliver Gibson at 53
content: Oliver Gibson, a former NFL defensive tackle for the Steelers and Bengals, has passed away at 53. Known for his toughness and leadership, Gibson played nine seasons after being drafted from Notre Dame. Tributes have poured in from former teammates like Chad Johnson, highlighting his impact on and off the field, especially during his time in Pittsburgh.

title: India tour of England: Kuldeep Yadav's turn to shine at Edgbaston?
content: The Times of India in England: India set to go in with two Spinners in the second Test, starting from Wednesday. Washington Sundar is also in the fray, while Jaspit Bumrah’s chances of playing is negligible.

title: Happy National Doctor's Day 2025: Top 50 wishes, WhatsApp and Facebook status to share -
content: India observes National Doctor's Day on July 1, 2025, honoring medical professionals' dedication and sacrifices. This day commemorates Dr. Bidhan Chandra Roy, a physician and former Chief Minister of West Bengal. The occasion highlights doctors' crucial role in public health. People express gratitude through messages and social media, acknowledging their unwavering commitment to healing and well-being.

title: IND vs BAN: BCB president provides update on series; scheduled for August
content: The fate of India's scheduled cricket tour to Bangladesh this August hangs in the balance, according to BCB President Aminul Islam. While the itinerary, featuring ODIs and T20Is in Mirpur and Chattogram, was announced earlier, the BCCI is awaiting government approvals before confirming the visit.

title: 'Get your act together!' Trump blasts AT&T after delay in religious call
content: President Trump publicly criticized AT&T on Truth Social for technical difficulties that delayed a conference call with thousands of religious leaders. Trump expressed his frustration over the repeated issues and urged AT&T's leadership to intervene. AT&T responded, attributing the disruption to a problem with the conference call platform and worked to resolve the issue, which caused a 20-minute delay.

title: Court denies bail to 62-year-old for ‘Pakistan zindabad’ post
content: The Allahabad High Court denied bail to a 62-year-old man accused of sharing a "Pakistan Zindabad" post on Facebook. Justice Siddharth stated that judicial tolerance emboldens anti-national acts. The court deemed Ansar Ahmad Siddique's actions disrespectful to the Constitution and a challenge to national sovereignty. Siddique faces charges under the BNS.

title: Deal deadline 8 days away, US talks stay deadlocked
content: With the deadline looming for the US to reinstate reciprocal tariffs, India-US trade talks face a stalemate as New Delhi resists lowering duties on agricultural products like maize and dairy, a key demand from Washington.

title: 'Very strategic ally': White House confirms US-India trade deal 'very close'
content: The White House has reaffirmed the strong strategic alliance between the United States and India, signaling the potential completion of a long-awaited trade agreement. Officials are finalizing the details, with an announcement expected soon from President Trump and his trade team.

title: Punjab farmer missing since 9 days found in Pakistan custody
content: Amritpal Singh, a 23-year-old farmer from Punjab's Ferozepur, has been confirmed to be in Pakistan custody after going missing nine days ago. He is suspected to have crossed the Zero Line at the India-Pakistan border near Rana Panjgrain village. BSF authorities have contacted Pakistan Rangers and are working towards his return, according to his father.

title: Karnataka 2nd PUC exam 3 result 2025 likely today; here’s when & how to check scorecards
content: Karnataka School Examination and Assessment Board will likely announce the second Pre-University Course Exam 3 results today. Students can check scores on karresults.nic.in or kseab.karnataka.gov.in. Candidates need their register number and date of birth to access results. Exam 3 occurred from June 9 to June 21, 2025. This offers students a third chance to clear exams.

title: Jaishankar at UN: ‘No impunity to terrorists’; slams proxies and nuclear blackmail
content: S. Jaishankar urged the international community to unite against terrorism, emphasizing zero tolerance and accountability. He inaugurated "The Human Cost of Terrorism" exhibition at the UN, showcasing global terror attacks, including the Pahalgam strike. Jaishankar called for exposing state-sponsored terrorism and highlighted the exhibition's tribute to victims, urging the UN to act decisively against this grave threat.

title: 'Kannappa' box office collection: Prabhas-Akshay Kumar's epic mints Rs 2.5cr Monday
content: Vishnu Manchu's mythological drama 'Kannappa' is performing decently at the box office, earning ₹25.90 crore in its first four days. Despite an expected dip on Monday, the film held well, particularly in Telugu-speaking regions. Directed by Mukesh Kumar Singh, 'Kannappa' tells the story of a tribal warrior and features star cameos from Akshay Kumar, Prabhas and Mohanlal.

title: ‘They will lose...’: Musk slams US lawmakers over support for Trump’s bill
content: Elon Musk criticized US congress members who supported Donald Trump's tax-and-spending bill, labeling it the "biggest debt increase in history." He vowed to campaign against those who voted for the bill in the next primary election. The legislation, projected to increase the national debt by trillions, has faced backlash from fiscal conservatives, with a final Senate vote expected soon.

title: ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’: Film inches closer to Rs 130 crore
content: Aamir Khan's 'Sitaare Zameen Par,' also starring Genelia D’Souza, continues its successful box office run, nearing Rs. 130 crore after 11 days. Despite new releases, the film maintained a steady performance, outperforming Kajol's 'Maa' on its fourth day. Khan emphasizes the importance of audience support for diverse genres, encouraging filmmakers to explore meaningful stories.

title: Happy to be his wingman, says Papa, Shux’s backup astronaut
content: Group Captain Prashanth Balakrishnan Nair, affectionately known as Papa, supports Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla's historic ISS mission as his backup. Their rigorous training, collaborating with international partners, has strengthened their bond and prepared them for future Indian spaceflights. Papa emphasizes the importance of teamwork and acknowledges the collective effort behind their journey, eagerly anticipating India's Gaganyaan mission.

title: Ohio plane crash: Six killed in small aircraft accident
content: A tragic plane crash in Ohio claimed six lives, including four members of the Weller family and two pilots, shortly after takeoff from Youngstown-Warren Regional Airport. The Cessna 441, bound for Bozeman, Montana, crashed in a wooded area, leaving no survivors. Among the victims was Joseph Maxin, a former prosecutor and port authority official.

title: 41 years on, Bhopal disaster waste incinerated
content: The incineration of 337 metric tons of toxic waste from the Bhopal Gas Disaster has been completed at the Treatment Storage Disposal Facility in Pithampur, marking the end of a long chapter. Hazardous waste was transported from the Union Carbide factory in Bhopal to Pithampur for incineration.

title: National medical register struggles to get off the ground
content: India faces challenges in verifying doctors' credentials due to the lack of an updated medical registry. The National Medical Commission has struggled to verify a significant number of doctors, leading to concerns about unqualified individuals practicing medicine. Hospitals find it difficult to conduct background checks, and specialists are alarmed by the number of doctors practicing without proper specialization.

title: Florida Panthers lock in core before NHL free agency: Ekblad, Marchand sign long-term deals;
content: The Florida Panthers, fresh off their Stanley Cup victory, are proactively securing their core by re-signing Aaron Ekblad, Brad Marchand, and Sam Bennett to long-term deals before free agency. Other NHL teams, including the Blue Jackets, Islanders, Wild, and Maple Leafs, are also making moves through signings, extensions, and trades to reshape their rosters for the upcoming season.

title: Aadhaar gaps, deviation from syllabus raise CUET concerns
content: Concerns have emerged regarding the CUET-UG 2025 exam due to reported biometric verification gaps and shift-wise disparities. The absence of complete Aadhaar-based biometric authentication and uneven candidate distribution across shifts raise questions about fairness and comparability. Deviations from the syllabus in certain subjects further contribute to doubts about the exam's integrity.

title: Andhra Pradesh launches ‘Digi-Lakshmi’ scheme to empower urban poor women
content: More than 9,000 Common Service Centres will set up across all Urban Local Bodies as part of the scheme, offering around 250 public services

title: A govt officer in Odisha found to have acquired 84 acre of land
content: Vigilance directorate has also traced other high valued properties in Bhubaneswar and Nabarangpur towns

title: India-U.S. trade deal: Two countries need to find common ground; will have to watch this space for next few days, says Jaishankar
content: “And just like the U.S. or people in the U.S. may have views about India, people in India have views about the U.S. too. And we’ll have to find a kind of meeting ground. I believe it’s possible,” Mr. Jaishankar said

title: 26 patients evacuated after minor fire at burns ward in State-run Victoria Hospital in Bengaluru
content: The fire is suspected to have originated from a short circuit in a switch board; all 26 patients, including five in the ICU shifted to H-Block of the hospital for uninterrupted care.

title: Akali Dal accuses AAP of resorting to political vendetta; AAP hits back
content: In the meeting of the party’s core committee held in Chandigarh, which was presided over by party president Sukhbir Singh Badal, it was announced that the party would start a people’s campaign against the corruption and scams prevailing in the government.

title: TTD to develop special online application for professional ‘Srivari Sevaks’
content: The initiative aims at utilising the services of professionals from around the globe and integrate their services in ten key departments in the TTD

title: Power supply cut off at Chinnaswamy Stadium over fire safety violations; HC pulls up BESCOM
content: This action was taken after the Director General of the Department of Fire and Emergency Services wrote to the BESCOM Managing Director, directing the disconnection of the stadium's electricity for failing to implement recommended fire safety measures.

title: Three militants arrested in Manipur
content: One active cadre of the banned United National Liberation Front (P) was apprehended from the Khurai Kongpal area in Imphal East district

title: Ravada A. Chandrasekhar takes charge as Kerala’s State Police Chief, vows crackdown on drug abuse
content: A 1991-batch IPS officer, he was selected from a panel shortlisted by UPSC. He previously served as Special Director of Intelligence Bureau under Central deputation

title: 19-kg Commercial LPG cylinder price slashed by ₹58.50, no change in domestic cylinder rates
content: With the reduction in prices the cylinder will cost ₹1,665 in Delhi, ₹1,616 in Mumbai, ₹1,769 in Kolkata and ₹1,823.50 in Chennai.

title: Pahalgam attack was act of economic warfare, says External Affairs Minister Jaishankar
content: Union Minister Jaishankar is on an official visit to the U.S. and will travel to Washington DC to participate in the Quad Foreign Ministers' Meeting on July 1, 2025.

title: Telangana pharma factory blast LIVE: Death toll rises to 35
content: Special forensic team from Osmania General Hospital has been brought in to assist with post mortems and DNA sample collection

title: North Chennai residents, experts to propose alternatives to waste-to-energy plant in Kodungaiyur
content: Residents, under the aegis of the Federation of North Chennai Residents’ Welfare Associations, have opposed the project since its proposal, citing pollution concerns

title: BJP gets new State chiefs, moves closer to elect national president
content: The BJP's constitution requires the election of its presidents in at least 19 out of its 37 organisational States before the process to elect its national president begins

title: Telangana pharma factory blast: Death toll rises to 35, DNA identification under way at Patancheru hospital
content: Autopsies have been completed on 15 bodies, with only four victims identified; special forensic team from Osmania General Hospital brought in to assist

title: A.P. govt. and partners issue Amaravati Quantum Declaration
content: The six joint commitments in the declaration include living-lab infra, indigenous supply-chain acceleration, capacity building, investment catalyst and global collaboration

title: Former MLC N. Ramchander Rao to take charge as BJP State president on Tuesday
content: There was high drama of Goshamahal MLA T. Raja Singh storming out in protest for ‘not being allowed’ to file his nomination papers for the party chief and also announced quitting the party

title: Ahead of Maharashtra Assembly’s monsoon session, transit camp residents relocated
content: Residents of a four-decade-old transit camp staged a protest near the Maharashtra Vidhan Bhavan on Monday, seeking action on long-pending rehabilitation issues

title: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh flags 'withdrawal' of NITI Aayog's working paper on Indo-U.S. trade
content: The NITI Aayog had in a working paper, suggested that in the aftermath of "reciprocal tariffs" imposed by the US, India should adopt a dual-track approach

title: 'No impunity to terrorists', 'no yielding to nuclear blackmail': EAM Jaishankar at U.N.
content: “By now we know well that terrorism anywhere is a threat to peace everywhere. Let that understanding guide our collective thinking and response”

title: Peace accord entirely represents Mizoram: Zoramthanga
content: The 39th anniversary of the Mizo peace accord was celebrated by the Mizo National Front across the State on Monday

title: Police resort lathi-charge in Bhogandih on the occasion of Hul Diwas
content: Jharkhand Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) president and Leader of opposition Babulal Marandi strongly condemned the incident calling it a barbaric act on the tribal community.

title: Kerala HC reiterates need for dedicated authority to protect Periyar
content: The High Court had earlier expressed concern at the grave health hazards due to increasing pollution of the river.

title: Bihar BJP attempts to break RJD’s Muslim votes through Pasmanda
content: State president Dilip Jaiswal said that in Bihar, politics has always been done in the name of Muslims, but no real efforts were ever made to uplift the Pasmanda Muslims. He also assured their political representation.

title: Congress leader challenges Haryana power tariff hike, files review petition
content: The tariff revision, which came into effect in April, has been met with resistance from various consumer categories, including industrial associations and domestic users

title: Unauthorised halt by private buses poses challenge to school
content: The problem persists despite repeated pleas to bus operators and several memorandums submitted to officials concerned

title: Tripura government orders probe into assault of two school students
content: The students of the State’s first higher education school were allegedly assaulted by seniors after the former refused to purchase alcohol for them

title: A year after enforcement of new criminal laws began, T.N. government works on more State amendments
content: In its first list of State amendments proposed to the Government of India, it has sought changes in the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita

title: Stalin’s inaction has resulted in custodial deaths, says L. Murugan
content: Speaking to journalists in Tiruchi, he alleges that the police are neither listening to the Chief Minister nor following his instructions

title: New CM in Karnataka? Kharge gives 'high command' hint; Sidda-DKS put up united front
content: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge hinted at a possible leadership change in Karnataka, stating the party high command has the power to act. Chief Minister Siddaramaiah dismissed rumors of discord with Deputy CM DK Shivakumar, affirming their government will remain stable for five years.

title: First State-led digital public infra for AI TGDeX set for launch in Telangana on July 2
content: TGDeX is aimed at developing cross-domain AI solutions through collaboration between the State, startups, industry partners and research institutions

title: Journalism stalwart Dasu Krishnamoorty turns 100 on July 1
content: Hailing from a family of journalists, Krishnamoorty belonged to the first batch of journalism students at Osmania University in 1954-55

title: MeeSeva expanded to issue market value certificates, marriage registration bookings
content: The inclusions are part of its expanding suite of services and reinforces its position as a trusted gateway for Telangana citizens, IT and Industries Minister D.Sridhar Babu’s office said

title: 5 policemen held in Sivaganga custodial torture case; victim’s body bore over 30 injury marks
content: The arrests were made on a day the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court observed that the case had to be viewed seriously.

title: Border dispute with India complicated, takes time; ready to discuss delimitation, says China
content: Rajnath Singh, in his meeting with Chinese counterpart Dong Jun in Qingdao on June 26, proposed that India and China should solve the “complex issues” under a structured road map comprising steps to de-escalate tensions along the frontiers and rejuvenate the existing mechanism to demarcate the borders

title: Now, 12-car EMU trains will operate on three sections of Chennai’s suburban railway network
content: EMU trains get an upgrade from nine-car coaches to 12; this ensures a 21% increase in the seating capacity, sufficient to accommodate an additional four lakh passengers daily, a senior official says

title: A.P.’s Polavaram–Banakacherla project fails to get environmental clearance
content: Central Water Commission should be consulted for a comprehensive evaluation of floodwater management and addressing environmental and inter-State concerns, says EAC

title: Bengal police summon Padma-awardee monk after woman alleges rape
content: Trinamool, which posted photographs of the monk with top BJP leaders, says the BJP is shielding the accused. Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar hints that the accusation might be politically motivated.

title: M.P. HC issues notice to Centre, NHAI over long traffic snarls on Indore-Dewas highway
content: Over the past few days, long queues of vehicles were witnessed on the highway causing over 30-hours of jam on Friday

title: SC survey: 91.84% of projected population enumerated
content: After multiple extensions, Monday was the last day of the survey by the commission headed by Nagamohan Das

title: Independent probe sought in gang rape of law college student case
content: Calcutta High Court admits PILs for independent investigation into the gang rape case; BJP delegation visits college

title: Senior officer dragged from office, beaten up in Bhubaneswar
content: The attackers were linked to a senior BJP leader who unsuccessfully contested the State Assembly election in 2024; former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik criticised the Mohan Majhi government

title: Post-stampede, police training manual revised with learnings from incident, CPR training now mandatory
content: Karnataka Police Academy has taken up the incident as a case study and has prepared a detailed learning points module

title: Manipur civil society groups discuss peace process with Home Ministry officials
content: The groups — Coordinating Committee on Manipur Integrity, All Manipur United Clubs’ Organisation, and Federation of Civil Society Organisations — discuss peace roadmap and restoration of popular government

title: Classes at South Calcutta Law College suspended, as protests erupt over rape of student
content: Bharatiya Janata Party supporters clashed with the police and other protestors in various parts of the city on Monday, June 30, as a four-member fact-finding team of the saffron party arrived in the city

title: Army Chief embarks on four-day visit to Bhutan
content: The visit reflects the deep-rooted and time-tested ties between India and Bhutan, and reaffirms India’s commitment to a close and trusted partner, a press statement said

title: Toll on NICE Road hiked effective July 1
content: Tolls on other access controlled corridors like the Electronics City Expressway have also been hiked with effect from July 1

title: Axiom-4 mission: Shubhanshu Shukla to interact with students via ham radio on July 4
content: Group Captain Shukla who is spending 14 days in the ISS will connect with U.R. Rao Satellite Centre in Bengaluru at 3.47 p.m. IST on July 4.

title: States must announce cooperative policy by January 31, says Amit Shah
content: The Union Home and Cooperation Minister chaired a “Manthan Baithak” with all the States’ Cooperation Ministers, emphasising the importance of GDP, GSDP growth and job creation for the country

title: Defence Ministry set to clear major acquisitions post Operation Sindoor
content: Spy aircraft, air defence missile systems, sea mines, and autonomous vessels on agenda at upcoming DAC meeting

title: Voter verification drive in Bihar: too little time, too many hurdles
content: Within a month, a staggering 4.76 crore people will have to prove their citizenship in order to vote in the next election

title: Language row turns political: MVA, MNS claim victory as Maharashtra govt. backtracks
content: Facing intense backlash from civil society and Opposition parties, the Maharashtra government has rescinded two govt. resolutions mandating Hindi as a compulsory third language in schools; the State will now form an expert committee to review the language policy and suggest a way forward

title: PM Modi’s five-nation tour likely to focus on defence cooperation, Africa outreach, and multilaterals
content: The Prime Minister is visiting Ghana, Trinidad and Tobago, Argentina, Brazil, and Namibia on July 2-9; he is also participating in the BRICS summit while in Brazil

title: India to get above-normal rain in July, forecasts IMD
content: States such as Chhattisgarh, Odisha, and Telangana should be watchful as catchment areas of rivers such as the Krishna, Godavari, Mahanadi could receive heavy rain, the Met office says

title: L.V. Prasad vision centre opened at Mandadam
content: A free walk-in clinic, accessible to everyone regardless of socio-economic status, it is equipped to perform both anterior and posterior segment examinations, along with teleconsultation facilities

title: 683 species added to India’s fauna, 433 taxa to its flora during 2024
content: With 101 species, Kerala recorded highest number of fauna discoveries, followed by Karnataka — 82; Tamil Nadu recorded 63 discoveries

title: NBA free agency grades: Hawks, Rockets make early splashes; Grizzlies' Jackson lands $240M extension
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings and extensions, including early summer winners in Houston, Atlanta and Memphis.

title: Sources: Nuggets trading MPJ to Nets for Johnson
content: The Nuggets will trade Michael Porter Jr. and an unprotected 2032 first-round pick to the Nets for Cam Johnson, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Sources: Mavs agree to $13M deal with PG Russell
content: Free agent point guard D'Angelo Russell has agreed to a two-year, $13 million deal with the Dallas Mavericks, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania.

title: Al Hilal eliminate Manchester City in CWC stunner
content: Saudi club Al Hilal pulled off a surprise upset on Monday, defeating Manchester City 4-3 in extra time in Orlando to advance to the quarterfinals of the Club World Cup.

title: Abreu hits grand slam, inside-the-park HR for Sox
content: Wilyer Abreu hit a grand slam and an inside-the-park solo home run for the Boston Red Sox on Monday, in a rousing 13-6 victory over the Cincinnati Reds at Fenway Park, and according to ESPN Research, he's the first player to pull off the feat since 1958.

title: Sources: Grizz to extend Jackson on $240M deal
content: The Memphis Grizzlies and All-Star Jaren Jackson Jr. are expected to agree to a five-year, $240 million maximum renegotiation-and-extension.

title: Sources: Lopez has 2-year, $18M deal with Clips
content: Free agent center Brook Lopez agreed to a two-year, $18 million deal with the Los Angeles Clippers, sources told ESPN.

title: Kane returns to Wings with 1-year, $3M contract
content: The Detroit Red Wings signed forward Patrick Kane, 36, to a one-year contract extension worth $3 million, the club announced Monday night, allowing the American winger to avoid unrestricted free agency Tuesday after he scored 21 goals last season.

title: Sources: Clarkson expected to sign with Knicks
content: Jordan Clarkson is expected to sign with the Knicks after he clears free agency waivers, sources said Monday.

title: 💍 Bakhtiari trolls Rodgers at Love's wedding
content: Jordan Love tied the knot with Ronika Stone over the weekend, and former Packer David Bakhtiari seemingly trolled Aaron Rodgers in congratulatory post.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: 2026 NFL mock draft: Miller's early projections for the first round, including four QBs
content: What might the Browns and Rams do with their first-rounders? How many QBs could go on Day 1? Here's Matt Miller's early look at the 2026 draft.

title: Experts' picks: Who will win Wimbledon?
content: Wimbledon kicks off with a wide-open women's field and some clear favorites on the men's side. Our experts make their predictions.

title: Caitlin Clark's status, 3-pointers and fast-break points: Keys to Tuesday's Commissioner's Cup final
content: Minnesota has set the bar for consistency this season. Indiana? Not so much. And Caitlin Clark's status is uncertain.

title: What to know about WNBA expansion to Cleveland, Detroit and Philadelphia
content: Why is the WNBA expanding now? How will it impact the CBA and draft? What will more roster spots and NBA ownership mean?

title: NHL free agency preview: How each team can earn an A-plus
content: With the market set to open Tuesday, we identify key free agents for each club -- and what each GM should do.

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself during the Gold Cup -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure. No matter the situation, this team can come out on top.

title: Winning the offseason? Here are the biggest surprise players on each NFL team

content: When does your favorite team pick in every round of the draft? Here's a pick-by-pick look at all 20 rounds.

title: Married in Manhattan: Zach Wilson ties knot with Nicolette Dellanno in New York
content: Quarterback Zach Wilson got married over the weekend to Nicolette Dellanno a year after their engagement.

title: Fight grades: UFC 317 was the best pay-per-view of 2025
content: UFC 317 gets the best report card of the year so far. It was all-around entertaining and included one near-perfect fight.

title: Lautaro rips Inter after CWC exit: 'Fight, or leave'
content: Inter captain Lautaro Martínez sharply criticized his team's lack of commitment and performance after the 2-0 loss against Fluminense in the Club World Cup round of 16.

title: 'Big possibility' Mbappé plays for Madrid vs. Juve
content: Kylian Mbappé is close to making his FIFA Club World Cup debut in Real Madrid's round of 16 clash against Juventus at the Club World Cup, with coach Xabi Alonso saying it is a "big possibility" that the forward will be fit to play.

title: FIFPRO: U.S. temps a concern for '26 World Cup
content: FIFPRO has raised concerns over the effect of intense heat during the FIFA Club World Cup in the United States by saying that two games -- Paris Saint-Germain-Atlético Madrid and Chelsea-Esperance -- should have been postponed due to extreme heat.

title: Torrent: Time with Pep key vs. 'superior' Dortmund
content: Monterrey head coach Domenec Torrent admitted his team faces a superior opponent in Borussia Dortmund in the Club World Cup round of 16 on Tuesday night at Mercedes-Benz Stadium in Atlanta, but he expects the Liga MX side to compete well.

title: Neymar to play until 'I can no longer perform'
content: Brazil forward Neymar has said he will continue playing football until he can 'no longer perform' as he wants to.

title: Liverpool's Hinds leaves club amid Arsenal talks
content: Liverpool Women have confirmed vice-captain Taylor Hinds has decided to leave the club, with a source telling ESPN she is in talks with Arsenal.

title: What the trade to Steelers means for Jonnu Smith's value
content: Jonnu Smith had a breakout season in Miami last season, but will he be able to follow it up after being traded to the Steelers?

title: Breaking down the best and worst of the NBA draft
content: Who was the steal of the draft? Which teams made risky moves? Our experts share their postdraft superlatives.

title: Best power half-seasons ever: Where Cal Raleigh and Aaron Judge rank -- and whether they can keep it up

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 and a top-5 debut
content: The Mets falling as their slump continues and the Astros notching their highest ranking of the season.

title: "If Chief Minister Not Changed Now...": MLA On Siddaramaiah vs DK Shivakumar

title: Kolkata Rape Accused's 'Hang The Rapist' Video After RG Kar Case Goes Viral
content: On August 16 last year, days after a doctor's rape-murder in Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College and Hospital, Monojit Mishra shared on Facebook a video of West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee leading a protest march

title: CBI To Question Bank Staff In Rs 8.5 Lakh Mule Account Cyber Fraud Case
content: The CBI will start questioning bank officials under scanner for allegedly facilitating the operations of 8.5 lakh mule accounts in a "pan India conspiracy" with cyber crime syndicates to launder crime proceeds, agency officials said.

title: PM Modi Greetings To All Hardworking Doctors On National Doctor's Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday greeted all the doctors on the occasion of National Doctor's Day.

title: Bengaluru Cracks Down On Auto Overcharging, 98 Seized, 260 Case Filed
content: In a crackdown against autorickshaws overcharging and plying illegally, Karnataka transport department authorities on Monday registered 260 cases and seized 98 vehicles.

title: Tamil Nadu Custodial Death: 5 Policemen Arrested, Murder Charges Filed
content: Five policemen have been arrested in connection with a custodial death in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga district, police said.

title: Unemployed Man Kills Partner Out Of Jealousy, Sleeps Next To Body For 2 Days
content: Sachin, jobless and consumed by jealousy, suspected Ritika, who worked in a private firm, of having an affair with her boss.

title: 'No Magic Wand To Be Like 20-Year-Old, Know Where To Stop': Khushbu Sundar

title: Musk Has A Party Name And Launch Date Ready. All Eyes Now On Trump's Bill
content: As the US Senate inches closer to a vote on the White House's massive tax and immigration agenda, billionaire Elon Musk renewed his criticism of Donald Trump's "One Big Beautiful Bill", threatening to unseat the lawmakers who support the package.

title: 32 Killed In Telangana Factory Blast, Many Critical, 27 Still Missing
content: The number of deaths in the explosion in a pharmaceutical unit at Pashamylaram near Hyderabad rose sharply to 32 on Tuesday, with about 15 injured succumbing at hospitals overnight.

title: At Madhya Pradesh Hospital, Man Sits On Chest Of Teen, Slits Her Throat

title: 62 Lakh Vehicles Won't Get Petrol, Diesel In Delhi From Today
content: Vehicles are the top polluters in the national capital Delhi, accounting for more than half (51 per cent) of the pollution from all local emission sources.

title: Indian-Origin Man Gets Jai, 3 Cane Strokes For Rioting In Singapore
content: An Indian origin man has been sentenced to two years and three months in jail, and three strokes of the cane, after pleading guilty to a rioting charge in which another man was killed at a nightspot in 2023.

title: BJP Gets New State Chiefs, Moves Closer To Elect New National President
content: BJP moved towards rolling out the exercise to have a new national president as the party elected chiefs in some states and is set to announce more on Tuesday, which will put the requisite number of state heads to pick the new party President.

content: Bharti Jain is senior editor with the Times of India, new Delhi . she has been writing on security matters since 1996 . her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife .

title: No rift with DKS, govt will stand firm for 5 years like a rock: Siddaramaiah
